CatDescriptText: Miss Corrine Boyd, Schenley High School senior, 6 Mercer Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 15, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think common-law marriage should be outlawed?" answer reads: "I think that it should be ruled illegal because it's not right to live with a man without marrying him."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Corrine Boyd, wearing light colored trench coat, tweed skirt, and hoop earrings, stand with left hand on hip in front of chain link fence with buildings in background
